abstract: Two unions jointly criticized IMDb.com, a widely used Internet movie site, for showing the ages of actors, saying it "facilitates age discrimination.''
snippet: Two unions jointly criticized IMDb.com, a widely used Internet movie site, for showing the ages of actors, saying it "facilitates age discrimination.''

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Federation of Television and Radio Artists

lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES - Hollywood's acting unions aren't quite arguing for the right to lie about your age. But they seemed to come close on Thursday with a statement condemning the Internet Movie Database - IMDb.com - for routinely posting actors' ages on its widely used Web site.

headline.main: Unions Condemn Internet Movie Site for Posting Actors' Ages
